elements.content: Self-assembly synthesis in water, at room temperature, with dinuclear copper triethanolaminate and aqua−sodium building blocks as well as benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylate linkers leads to the formation of an heteronuclear Cu−Na assembly with a two-dimensional metal−organic framework, providing the first example of an aqua-soluble copper-containing coordination polymer that hosts infinite chains of decameric water clusters (H2O)10 formed by quasiplanar cyclic water octamers with two pendent water molecules.
elements.clean_text: Self-assembly synthesis in water, at room temperature, with dinuclear copper triethanolaminate and aqua-sodium building blocks as well as benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylate linkers leads to the formation of an heteronuclear Cu-Na assembly with a two-dimensional metal-organic framework, providing the first example of an aqua-soluble copper-containing coordination polymer that hosts infinite chains of decameric water clusters (H2O)10 formed by quasiplanar cyclic water octamers with two pendent water molecules.

elements.content: A novel highly water-soluble copper−sodium two-dimensional coordination polymer with pyromellitate linkers has been easily self-assembled and shown to host infinite chains of decameric water clusters formed by quasi-planar cyclic octamers with two pendent H2O molecules.
elements.clean_text: A novel highly water-soluble copper-sodium two-dimensional coordination polymer with pyromellitate linkers has been easily self-assembled and shown to host infinite chains of decameric water clusters formed by quasi-planar cyclic octamers with two pendent H2O molecules.

elements.content: Copper-containing coordination polymers are an important class of compounds in view of their growing significance, for example, as porous solids, sensors, molecular magnets, optical materials, and in supramolecular chemistry and catalysis. Although a large diversity of metal coordination polymers has been reported, namely, for copper, aqua-soluble examples remain very scant. Furthermore, several examples of copper coordination frameworks that host various multimeric water clusters, namely, water tetramer, hexamer, decamer, and hexadecamer, have been reported recently and structurally characterized, thus contributing to the important understanding, for example, of self-assembly processes, stabilization of supramolecular systems, functioning of biomolecules, protein crystallization, bulk water properties, and structure of ice.
elements.clean_text: Copper-containing coordination polymers are an important class of compounds in view of their growing significance, for example, as porous solids, sensors, molecular magnets, optical materials, and in supramolecular chemistry and catalysis. Although a large diversity of metal coordination polymers has been reported, namely, for copper, aqua-soluble examples remain very scant. Furthermore, several examples of copper coordination frameworks that host various multimeric water clusters, namely, water tetramer, hexamer, decamer, and hexadecamer, have been reported recently and structurally characterized, thus contributing to the important understanding, for example, of self-assembly processes, stabilization of supramolecular systems, functioning of biomolecules, protein crystallization, bulk water properties, and structure of ice.

elements.content: We now report a new highly water-soluble heteronuclear copper/sodium-containing coordination polymer, bearing infinite chains of a rare (or even unknown) type of decameric water cluster formed by cyclic water octamers with two pendent water molecules, which is easily obtained by self-assembly synthesis. The two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymer is derived from dinuclear copper triethanolaminate and aqua−sodium building blocks, and benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylate (pyromellitate) linkers. The simple combination in aqueous solution and at room temperature of copper(II) nitrate, triethanolamine (H3tea), benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylic (pyromellitic) acid (H4pma), and sodium hydroxide provides the formation of a highly water-soluble heterodimetallic polymer [Cu2(H2tea)2(pma)Na2(H2O)4)] n ·10nH2O (1) hosting infinite chains of decameric water clusters (Scheme ), isolated as an air-stable crystalline solid and characterized by IR and UV−Vis spectroscopies, elemental analysis, and X-ray crystallography.
elements.clean_text: We now report a new highly water-soluble heteronuclear copper/sodium-containing coordination polymer, bearing infinite chains of a rare (or even unknown) type of decameric water cluster formed by cyclic water octamers with two pendent water molecules, which is easily obtained by self-assembly synthesis. The two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymer is derived from dinuclear copper triethanolaminate and aqua-sodium building blocks, and benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylate (pyromellitate) linkers. The simple combination in aqueous solution and at room temperature of copper(II) nitrate, triethanolamine (H3tea), benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylic (pyromellitic) acid (H4pma), and sodium hydroxide provides the formation of a highly water-soluble heterodimetallic polymer [Cu2(H2tea)2(pma)Na2(H2O)4)] n ⋅10nH2O (1) hosting infinite chains of decameric water clusters (Scheme ), isolated as an air-stable crystalline solid and characterized by IR and UV-Vis spectroscopies, elemental analysis, and X-ray crystallography.

elements.content:
Schematic Representation of1 a

a   Numbers indicate the corresponding extensions of polynuclear chains.
elements.clean_text: 1  Schematic Representation of1  a        a   Numbers indicate the corresponding extensions of polynuclear chains.

elements.content: X-ray crystal analysis reveals that the solid-state structure of 1 consists of infinite sheets of binuclear copper and sodium blocks linked by benzene−tetracarboxylate connectors forming a 2D network with a grid-type motif. Three kinds of polynuclear chains can be observed (Figure a), based on −Cu2−Na2−, −Cu2−pma−Cu2−, and −Na2−pma−Na2− motifs. The geometry around the hexacoordinated copper centers is distorted tetragonal bipyramidal, while sodium atoms share the edges in a distorted octahedral fashion (Figure b). H2tea acts as a tetradentate ligand with one bridging alkoxo group forming the centrosymmetric and essentially planar [Cu2(H2tea)2]2+ units with Cu−Cu separation of ca. 2.96 Å. One of the H2tea oxygens is bound to the sodium center, thus linking Cu units with dinuclear sodium blocks. The latter are composed of two bridging and two terminal water molecules forming [(H2O)Na(μ-H2O)2Na(H2O)]2+ moieties with Na−Na separation of ca. 3.40 Å. The overall positive charge of [Cu2(H2tea)2Na2(H2O)4]4+ blocks is balanced by tetradentate [pma]4- linkers that provide the formation of further polynuclear chains. Thus, each benzene-tetracarboxylate ligand is connected, via 1,2,4,5-coordination, to two sodium atoms from different chains, whereas 2,4-coordination is additionally shared with copper centers, leading to the formation of Na(μ-Opma)(μ-OHtea)Cu rings with a Na−Cu distance of ca. 3.68 Å (Figure c). Although the Cu and Na dinuclear building blocks are constructed from different ligands and display distinct bonding parameters and geometries (Figure b,c), the adjacent Cu−Cu separations are respectively equal to those of the Na−Na pairs (for both horizontal (9.3604(11) Å) and vertical (10.8601(9) Å) chains shown in Figure ). These distances are equivalent to the a and b unit cell dimensions, respectively, whereas the corresponding c parameter (11.3165(11) Å) is identical to the separation between the wavelike zigzag type chains found if the 2D sheets are viewed from the side (Figure a). Most of the bonding parameters within the metal−organic framework in 1 (Figure ) do not differ significantly from the expected values found for other related copper and/or sodium coordination polymers.
elements.clean_text: X-ray crystal analysis reveals that the solid-state structure of 1 consists of infinite sheets of binuclear copper and sodium blocks linked by benzene-tetracarboxylate connectors forming a 2D network with a grid-type motif. Three kinds of polynuclear chains can be observed (Figure a), based on -Cu2-Na2-, -Cu2-pma-Cu2-, and -Na2-pma-Na2- motifs. The geometry around the hexacoordinated copper centers is distorted tetragonal bipyramidal, while sodium atoms share the edges in a distorted octahedral fashion (Figure b). H2tea acts as a tetradentate ligand with one bridging alkoxo group forming the centrosymmetric and essentially planar [Cu2(H2tea)2]2+ units with Cu-Cu separation of ca. 2.96 Å. One of the H2tea oxygens is bound to the sodium center, thus linking Cu units with dinuclear sodium blocks. The latter are composed of two bridging and two terminal water molecules forming [(H2O)Na(μ-H2O)2Na(H2O)]2+ moieties with Na-Na separation of ca. 3.40 Å. The overall positive charge of [Cu2(H2tea)2Na2(H2O)4]4+ blocks is balanced by tetradentate [pma]4- linkers that provide the formation of further polynuclear chains. Thus, each benzene-tetracarboxylate ligand is connected, via 1,2,4,5-coordination, to two sodium atoms from different chains, whereas 2,4-coordination is additionally shared with copper centers, leading to the formation of Na(μ-Opma)(μ-OHtea)Cu rings with a Na-Cu distance of ca. 3.68 Å (Figure c). Although the Cu and Na dinuclear building blocks are constructed from different ligands and display distinct bonding parameters and geometries (Figure b,c), the adjacent Cu-Cu separations are respectively equal to those of the Na-Na pairs (for both horizontal (9.3604(11) Å) and vertical (10.8601(9) Å) chains shown in Figure ). These distances are equivalent to the a and b unit cell dimensions, respectively, whereas the corresponding c parameter (11.3165(11) Å) is identical to the separation between the wavelike zigzag type chains found if the 2D sheets are viewed from the side (Figure a). Most of the bonding parameters within the metal-organic framework in 1 (Figure ) do not differ significantly from the expected values found for other related copper and/or sodium coordination polymers.

Cu green, Na purple, N light-blue, O red, C gray. Selected bond lengths (Å) and angles (°):  Cu1−O2 2.454(3), Cu1−O4 2.519(3), Cu1−O6 1.955(2), Cu1−O12A 1.987(2), Cu1−N1 2.048(3), Cu1−O6i 1.953(2), Na1−O4 2.436(3), Na1−O7 2.3935(13), Na1−O8 2.4146(13), Na1−O12A 2.564(3), Na1−O14B 2.298(3), Na1−O7ii 2.4070(14); O4−Cu1−O12A 79.21(10), Cu1−O4−Na1 95.92(12), Cu1−O6−Cu1i 98.65(9), Cu1−O12A-Na1 107.25(10), O4−Na1−O12A 70.90(8), Na1−O7−Na1ii 90.10(5). Symmetry transformations used to generate the equivalent atoms:  (i) 1 − x, −y, 1 − z; (ii) −x, −y, 1 − z.

Cu green, Na purple, N light-blue, O red, C gray, H light-grey.

elements.content: Moreover, this framework hosts chains of hydrogen-bonded clusters of molecules of crystallization water (Figure a). Each decameric cluster is formed by a quasiplanar cyclic water octamer and two pendent water molecules (Figure b). In the (H2O)10 cluster, the average Owater···Owater separation of ca. 2.80 Å within the octameric core (Figure ) is longer than that of ca. 2.65 Å (O20−H20A···O10) connecting dangling water molecules, although the former value is comparable to the average O···O contact of ca. 2.85 Å found in liquid water and in other H2O clusters hosted by metal−organic frameworks. The decameric water clusters are further linked by hydrogen bonds to form infinite parallel chains intercalated in voids of the host metal−organic matrix of 1 (Figure a). The (H2O)10 clusters are interlaced with Cu−Na sheetscombining them by extended hydrogen-bonding contacts and providing in such a way an extension of the 2D structure to a third dimension (Figure ). The two dangling H2O molecules of every water cluster also have a structure stabilizing effect, each of them being hydrogen bonded to both oxygens of one carboxylate group (1- or 4-coordination) of a pyromellitate ligand. Furthermore, the decameric cluster formed by free lattice water can be extended to a larger (H2O)14 cluster by taking into account that the former is hydrogen bonded to four additional coordinated water molecules from the Na2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2 moiety. Hence, numerous O−H···O contacts involve all coordinated and crystallization H2O molecules, all triethanolaminate and carboxylate oxygens contributing to additional stabilization of units, chains, and sheets, and to their overall three-dimensional (3D) infinite network (Figure ).
elements.clean_text: Moreover, this framework hosts chains of hydrogen-bonded clusters of molecules of crystallization water (Figure a). Each decameric cluster is formed by a quasiplanar cyclic water octamer and two pendent water molecules (Figure b). In the (H2O)10 cluster, the average Owater⋅⋅⋅Owater separation of ca. 2.80 Å within the octameric core (Figure ) is longer than that of ca. 2.65 Å (O20-H20A⋅⋅⋅O10) connecting dangling water molecules, although the former value is comparable to the average O⋅⋅⋅O contact of ca. 2.85 Å found in liquid water and in other H2O clusters hosted by metal-organic frameworks. The decameric water clusters are further linked by hydrogen bonds to form infinite parallel chains intercalated in voids of the host metal-organic matrix of 1 (Figure a). The (H2O)10 clusters are interlaced with Cu-Na  sheetscombining them by extended hydrogen-bonding contacts and providing in such a way an extension of the 2D structure to a third dimension (Figure ). The two dangling H2O molecules of every water cluster also have a structure stabilizing effect, each of them being hydrogen bonded to both oxygens of one carboxylate group (1- or 4-coordination) of a pyromellitate ligand. Furthermore, the decameric cluster formed by free lattice water can be extended to a larger (H2O)14 cluster by taking into account that the former is hydrogen bonded to four additional coordinated water molecules from the Na2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2 moiety. Hence, numerous O-H⋅⋅⋅O contacts involve all coordinated and crystallization H2O molecules, all triethanolaminate and carboxylate oxygens contributing to additional stabilization of units, chains, and sheets, and to their overall three-dimensional (3D) infinite network (Figure ).

elements.content: Fragment of the crystal packing diagram of1 (rotated view along the b-axis) with hydrogen bonding network (dashed lines) providing an additional stabilization of units, chains, and sheets, as well as the formation of the 3D assembly (hydrogen atoms are omitted for clarity). Water oxygens related to the (H2O)10 clusters are shown as red balls with the atom labeling scheme. Hydrogen bonds (Å) within decameric water cluster:  O20−H20A···O10i 2.654, O20−H20B···O50ii 2.814, O30−H30B···O20iii 2.856, O40−H40A···O30 2.758, O50−H50A···O20iv 2.804, O50−H50B···O40 2.783. Symmetry transformations used to generate the equivalent atoms:  (i) x, y, 1 + z; (ii) −x, 1 − y, 1 - z; (iii) 1 − x, 1 − y, 1 − z; (iv) x, 1 + y, −1 + z.

elements.content: Although various phenylcarboxylates1,2 or aqua−sodium moieties3,11 often constitute a part of polynuclear frameworks, the now-obtained Cu−Na coordination polymer represents, to our knowledge, the first reported example comprising both types of species as well as involving the bridging Na2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2 moieties into a transition metal polynuclear network. Although some types of decameric H2O clusters, for example, with an ice Ic-like H2O arrangement, single cyclic ring, or cube-shaped core, have been observed or theoretically predicted, the present mode of the (H2O)10 cluster with a quasiplanar octameric core and two dangling water molecules in 1 is rather unusual. Moreover, the above observations on the similarity of interchain Cu−Cu and Na−Na separations in all dimensions with the unit cell parameters of 1 indicate a highly symmetrical and regular organization of this structure and constitute an uncommon feature, also in view of the heterometallic and heteroligand character.
elements.clean_text: Although various phenylcarboxylates1,2 or aqua-sodium moieties3,11 often constitute a part of polynuclear frameworks, the now-obtained Cu-Na coordination polymer represents, to our knowledge, the first reported example comprising both types of species as well as involving the bridging Na2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2 moieties into a transition metal polynuclear network. Although some types of decameric H2O clusters, for example, with an ice Ic-like H2O arrangement, single cyclic ring, or cube-shaped core, have been observed or theoretically predicted, the present mode of the (H2O)10 cluster with a quasiplanar octameric core and two dangling water molecules in 1 is rather unusual. Moreover, the  above observations on the similarity of interchain Cu-Cu and Na-Na separations in all dimensions with the unit cell parameters of 1 indicate a highly symmetrical and regular organization of this structure and constitute an uncommon feature, also in view of the heterometallic and heteroligand character.

elements.content: In addition, complex 1 provides the first example of a Cu-containing polymer that is highly soluble in water solution, with a solubility of ca. 110 mg mL-1, which is much higher than that commonly found in other transition metal coordination polymers. Although, in water solution, 1 should dissociate into ionic metal species (which is corroborated by molecular conductivity measurements [ΛM (H2O, 25 °C) = 275 Ω-1 cm2 mol-1 estimated for 1, n = 1] and can explain its unusually high solubility), its ability to recrystallize from the aqueous solution in the original form constitutes an important feature.
elements.clean_text: In addition, complex 1 provides the first example of a Cu-containing polymer that is highly soluble in water solution, with a solubility of ca. 110 mg mL-1, which is much higher than that commonly found in other transition metal coordination polymers. Although, in water solution, 1 should dissociate into ionic metal species (which is corroborated by molecular conductivity measurements [ΛM (H2O, 25 °C) = 275 Ω-1 cm2 mol-1 estimated for 1, n = 1] and can explain its unusually high solubility), its ability to recrystallize from the aqueous solution in the original form constitutes an important feature.

elements.content: Preliminary catalytic activity studies (to be reported in detail elsewhere) show that the polymer 1 acts as a selective homogeneous catalyst precursor for the oxidation of cyclohexane and cyclopentane, by H2O2 in H2O/MeCN, at room temperature and atmospheric pressure, to the corresponding alcohols and ketones (overall yield up to 26% for cyclohexane oxidation). This behavior, in pursuit of our interest in Cu-catalyzed processes, is of biological significance in view of the role, as an alkane oxygenase, of particulate methane monooxygenase, an enzyme with a multi-copper character, as has recently been established. Moreover, our system is based on an water-soluble metal compound, as rarely reported, in contrast with the majority of metalloenzyme models that are water-insoluble.
elements.clean_text: Preliminary catalytic activity studies (to be reported in detail elsewhere) show that the polymer 1 acts as a selective homogeneous catalyst precursor for the oxidation of cyclohexane and cyclopentane, by H2O2 in H2O/MeCN, at room temperature and atmospheric pressure, to the corresponding alcohols and ketones (overall yield up to 26% for cyclohexane oxidation). This behavior, in pursuit of our interest in Cu-catalyzed processes, is of biological significance in view of the role, as an alkane oxygenase, of particulate methane monooxygenase, an enzyme with a multi-copper character, as has recently been established. Moreover, our system is based on an water-soluble metal compound, as rarely reported, in contrast with the majority of metalloenzyme models that are water-insoluble.

elements.content: In summary, we have utilized cheap, commercially available, and environmentally tolerable chemicals to build, via self-assembly, a novel Cu−Na heteronuclear 2D coordination polymer hosting infinite chains of a rare type of decameric water cluster (cyclic octamers with two pendent molecules), which represents the first highly water-soluble example within the growing family of copper polymers. Further studies toward widening the family of water-soluble polynuclear frameworks with hosted H2O clusters based on transition metal centers and their application in catalysis are currently under way in our laboratory.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we have utilized cheap, commercially available, and environmentally tolerable chemicals to build, via self-assembly, a novel Cu-Na heteronuclear 2D coordination polymer hosting infinite chains of a rare type of decameric water cluster (cyclic octamers with two pendent molecules), which represents the first highly water-soluble example within the growing family of copper polymers. Further studies toward widening the family of water-soluble polynuclear frameworks with hosted H2O clusters based on transition metal centers and their application in catalysis are currently under way in our laboratory.

elements.content: Additional crystal packing diagrams and structural fragments of 1, selected bonding parameters and hydrogen bond geometry, experimental details for the collection and refinement of crystallographic data, and crystallographic information file (CIF). This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

Although, in water solution, 1 should dissociate into ionic metal species (which is corroborated by molecular conductivity measurements [ΛM (H2O, 25 °C) = 275 Ω-1 cm2 mol-1 estimated for 1, n = 1] and can explain its unusually high solubility), its ability to recrystallize from the aqueous solution in the original form constitutes an important feature.

cln_elements.clean_text: 3  Fragment of the crystal packing diagram of1 (rotated view along the b-axis) with hydrogen bonding network (dashed lines) providing an additional stabilization of units, chains, and sheets, as well as the formation of the 3D assembly (hydrogen atoms are omitted for clarity). Water oxygens related to the (H2O)10 clusters are shown as red balls with the atom labeling scheme. Hydrogen bonds (Å) within decameric water cluster: O20-H20A⋅⋅⋅O10i 2.654, O20-H20B⋅⋅⋅O50ii 2.814, O30-H30B⋅⋅⋅O20iii 2.856, O40-H40A⋅⋅⋅O30 2.758, O50-H50A⋅⋅⋅O20iv 2.804, O50-H50B⋅⋅⋅O40 2.783. Symmetry transformations used to generate the equivalent atoms: (i) x, y, 1 + z; (ii) -x, 1 - y, 1 - z; (iii) 1 - x, 1 - y, 1 - z; (iv) x, 1 + y, -1 + z.

metadata.title:
An Aqua-Soluble Copper(II)−Sodium Two-Dimensional Coordination Polymer
with Intercalated Infinite Chains of Decameric Water Clusters
author_list:
da Silva
M. Fátima C. Guedes
